Aptitude_Reasoning.q: A train 180 m long runs at 54 km/h. How long to cross a 120 m platform?
Which number replaces the question mark: 3, 9, 27, ?, 243
A test has 60 questions. A student answers 80% correctly. How many wrong?
If Monday was 3 days before yesterday, what day is tomorrow?
Average of 8 numbers is 15. Removing one number makes the average 14. Removed number?
A clock shows 3:15. What is the angle between hour and minute hands?
A person spends 1/3 on rent, 1/5 on food, and saves the rest. What fraction is saved?

Novel_Reasoning.q: All doctors are professionals. Some professionals are teachers. Can we conclude: 'Some teachers may be doctors'?
options: Only if all teachers are professionals

Novel_Reasoning.q: A cube has all faces painted. If cut into 27 equal cubes, how many small cubes have exactly 2 painted faces?
If PEN = 35 and INK = 34, then BOOK = ?
A farmer has 17 sheep. All but 9 run away. How many are left?
Odd one out: Apple, Mango, Banana, Potato

Personality_BigFive.q: In a team, I naturally take the lead to coordinate activities.
I stay calm and composed even in stressful workplace situations.
I enjoy socializing and interacting with colleagues regularly.
I pay close attention to details in my work.
I am open to trying new ideas and unconventional approaches.
I remain optimistic even during challenging tasks.
I adapt quickly to new environments or teams.

WorkValues_EmotionalIntelligence.q: I believe it’s important to work in a role that allows me to help others.
I can recognize when my emotions are affecting my decisions at work.
I value opportunities for personal growth in my career.
I am able to control my reactions during conflicts.
I believe teamwork leads to better outcomes than individual effort.
I try to understand others’ emotions in workplace interactions.
I am motivated by recognition and rewards for my work.

Career_Adaptability.q: I feel confident in adapting to new workplace technologies.
I am comfortable with career shifts and changes in industry trends.
I proactively prepare for possible future career changes.
I am able to learn new skills quickly to stay relevant.
I remain motivated even when career plans face setbacks.
I am confident in handling unexpected workplace transitions.
I believe adaptability is one of my strongest career traits.

Cognitive_Thinking.q: You are leading a project with a tight deadline. One member misses a key task. What’s your first response?
A client challenges your proposal with strong counterpoints. How do you react?
Your team disagrees on strategy. What’s the most effective step?
You must prioritize tasks: urgent but low-impact vs. high-impact but long-term. What do you do?
You receive incomplete data before a presentation. What do you do?
A junior makes a critical mistake. What’s your approach?
Your boss gives unclear instructions. What do you do?
